about.name: Copenhagen
about.info_text: Copenhagen is the capital and largest city of Denmark, known for its rich history, beautiful architecture, and a strong focus on sustainability. Situated on the eastern coast of the island of Zealand, the city is a hub of culture, innovation, and Scandinavian charm. Copenhagen offers a mix of historic landmarks, modern design, and a thriving culinary scene. Whether you're interested in exploring historic castles, riding a bike along picturesque canals, or savoring Danish pastries, Copenhagen has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 623,000
Region: Capital Region of Denmark
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+01:00)
Language: Danish, English
Currency: Danish Krone (DKK)
about.climate_text: Copenhagen has a temperate maritime climate with cool summers and mild winters. Summer temperatures average around 20°C (68°F), while winter temperatures range from 0°C (32°F) to 4°C (39°F).

attractions_card.title: Tivoli Gardens
attractions_card.description: Tivoli Gardens is one of the world's oldest amusement parks, offering rides, entertainment, and beautifully landscaped gardens.

attractions_card.title: The Little Mermaid
attractions_card.description: The Little Mermaid statue is an iconic symbol of Copenhagen, inspired by Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale.

attractions_card.title: Nyhavn
attractions_card.description: Nyhavn is a picturesque waterfront district with colorful buildings, waterfront cafes, and a lively atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Rosenborg Castle
attractions_card.description: Rosenborg Castle is a historic royal palace featuring the Danish Crown Jewels and beautiful Renaissance architecture.

attractions_card.title: Christiansborg Palace
attractions_card.description: Christiansborg Palace houses the Danish Parliament, the Prime Minister's Office, and the Supreme Court, and it's open for public tours.

attractions_card.title: The Round Tower
attractions_card.description: The Round Tower is a historic observatory with a unique spiral ramp providing panoramic views of the city.

attractions_card.title: National Gallery of Denmark
attractions_card.description: The National Gallery of Denmark (Statens Museum for Kunst) is the largest art museum in Denmark, showcasing a vast collection of European and Danish art.

attractions_card.title: Copenhagen Zoo
attractions_card.description: Copenhagen Zoo is home to a diverse range of animals and offers educational exhibits and experiences for visitors of all ages.

food_card.title: Smørrebrød
food_card.description: Smørrebrød is a traditional Danish open-faced sandwich, featuring various toppings like herring, roast beef, and liver pate.

food_card.title: Danish Pastries
food_card.description: Indulge in delicious Danish pastries, known as Wienerbrød, available in a variety of flavors and shapes.

food_card.title: New Nordic Cuisine
food_card.description: Experience the innovative New Nordic Cuisine movement at Michelin-starred restaurants, emphasizing local and seasonal ingredients.

food_card.title: Æbleskiver
food_card.description: Æbleskiver are Danish spherical pancakes, often served with powdered sugar and jam, perfect for a sweet treat.

food_card.title: Danish Hot Dogs
food_card.description: Try a Danish hot dog from a street vendor, typically served with a variety of toppings and sauces.

hotels_card.title: Hotel d'Angleterre
hotels_card.description: Hotel d'Angleterre is a luxurious and historic hotel located on Kongens Nytorv, offering elegant accommodations and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: Nimb Hotel
hotels_card.description: Nimb Hotel is a boutique hotel situated in Tivoli Gardens, providing a unique and stylish stay.

hotels_card.title: Wakeup Copenhagen
hotels_card.description: Wakeup Copenhagen is a modern and budget-friendly hotel with convenient locations in the city center.

hotels_card.title: Scandic Palace Hotel
hotels_card.description: Scandic Palace Hotel is a classic and comfortable hotel offering views of City Hall Square.

hotels_card.title: Vacation Rentals
hotels_card.description: Explore a variety of vacation rentals and apartment stays for a more independent and homely experience in Copenhagen.

transport_card.title: Copenhagen Airport
transport_card.description: Copenhagen Airport (CPH) is the primary international gateway to the city, offering numerous flight options.

transport_card.title: Metro and Trains
transport_card.description: Copenhagen's efficient metro and train system provide easy transportation within the city and to neighboring areas.

transport_card.title: Cycling
transport_card.description: Copenhagen is renowned for its cycling culture, with bike lanes and rentals available for eco-friendly exploration.

transport_card.title: Buses
transport_card.description: Public buses and sightseeing tour buses offer a convenient way to get around Copenhagen and see the sights.

transport_card.title: Harbor Ferries
transport_card.description: Explore Copenhagen from the water with the city's network of harbor ferries.
